title: 70 passengers left behind as Condor overbook boat
text:
Passengers in Poole this morning Credit: Tim Butler Seventy passengers have been left in Poole this morning after a ‘system error’ meant the Condor Liberation was overbooked.
Angry travellers were told that they could not board the boat as it was already full, and now have to wait until tomorrow to make their way back to Jersey.
The police were called to help calm the chaos in Poole as people were told the news.
Police were called to Poole to calm the chaos this morning Credit: Tim Butler Absolute chaos.
Booked on the boat originally due to sail at 9:30 on Sunday 20th. We were told it's sailing which it is, at 9.30. We arrived in time and joined the queue of cars and have now been told by staff of the ground that this ferry is an additional service and will be on a first come, first serves basis
Something need to be done with Condor now.
– Tim Butler, from Jersey trapped in Poole One passengers took this video of the moment they were told the situation by staff at Condor.
Play video It comes after a three days of major travel disruption on the Liberation, which started when the overnight Poole-Jersey-Poole service was cancelled in the early hours of Friday morning after a mechanical problem.
The boat was not deemed fit to sail yesterday and the Rapide has been used to try and accommodate some of the sailings.
All day trips were cancelled this weekend and the company is asking people with all non-essential travel between now and Wednesday to consider cancelling .
On behalf of Condor Ferries, I’d like to sincerely apologise for the disappointment and inconvenience this will cause to those passengers who are affected.
Our port teams have been working flat out and moved swiftly to help affected passengers revise their travel plans and to book them accommodation. We will also conduct a thorough investigation to find out how this systems error occurred and ensure that we improve our processes to prevent it happening again.
– Captain Fran Collins, Executive Director Operations, Condor Get the latest travel information here .
